TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit RegistrationHelper extends System.MarshalByRefObject implements class System.EnterpriseServices.IRegistrationHelper

Docs.summary: Installs and configures assemblies in the COM+ catalog. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks RegistrationHelper is used by both the .NET Services Installation Tool (Regsvcs.exe) and the automatic registration steps that are performed on first activation of a <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void InstallAssembly (string assembly, ref string application, ref string tlb, System.EnterpriseServices.InstallationFlags installFlags);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void InstallAssembly(string assembly, string application, string tlb, valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.InstallationFlags installFlags) cil managed

Docs.param: The file name of the assembly to install.

The name of the COM+ application to install into. This parameter can be . If the parameter is and the assembly contains a , then the attribute is used. Otherwise, the name of the application is generated based on the name of the assembly, then is returned.

The name of the output Type Library Exporter (Tlbexp.exe) file, or a string that contains if the registration helper is expected to generate the name. The actual name used is placed in the parameter on call completion.
A bitwise combination of the values.
Docs.summary: Installs the named assembly in a COM+ application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks InstallAssembly performs the following steps: registration, generation of a type library, registration of the type library, installation of the type library under the specified application, and configuration of the components contained in the type library.
This method requires the caller to have administrative privileges on the local computer.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the `InstalAssembly` method to install a named assembly in a COM+ application.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices Registration#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/de7f8e8b-41c6-47b1-a376-_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices Registration#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/de7f8e8b-41c6-47b1-a376-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices Registration#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/de7f8e8b-41c6-47b1-a376-_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The input assembly does not have a strong name.
Docs.permission: for the ability to access unmanaged code. Associated enumeration:
for the ability to access the registry. Associated enumeration:

Docs.param: The file name of the assembly to install.

The name of the COM+ application to install into. This parameter can be . If the parameter is and the assembly contains a , then the attribute is used. Otherwise, the name of the application is generated based on the name of the assembly, then is returned.
The name of the partition. This parameter can be .

The name of the output Type Library Exporter (Tlbexp.exe) file, or a string that contains if the registration helper is expected to generate the name. The actual name used is placed in the parameter on call completion.
A bitwise combination of the values.
Docs.summary: Installs the named assembly in a COM+ application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.RegistrationHelper.InstallAssembly%2A> performs the following steps: registration, generation of a type library, registration of the type library, installation of the type library under the specified application, and configuration of the components contained in the type library.
This method requires the caller to have administrative privileges on the local computer.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UninstallAssembly(string assembly, string application) cil managed

Docs.param: The file name of the assembly to uninstall.
If this name is not , it is the name of the application that contains the components in the assembly.
Docs.summary: Uninstalls the assembly from the given application.
